messages: 7c27020cdd748bf5c115f4ae870464e7 (17:19): Can I execute a JS function serverside?

189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (17:25): eu_neo myelement.firstChild.nodeValue

f96d123b2141b0d4c88bf2ec567ac153 (17:26): Raevel: doesn't work in ff
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (17:27): eu_neo ff creates textnodes with only whitespace sometimes
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (17:27): you could do myelement.innerHTML, it's a little ugly, but might be worth not having to do the extra work
f96d123b2141b0d4c88bf2ec567ac153 (17:32): i've tried with innerHTML and it doesn't work
583df3051db2f2f70adc2498a34de1b8 (17:32): eu_neo: both methods work
583df3051db2f2f70adc2498a34de1b8 (17:32): eu_neo: firefox just includes whitespace as text node (which is correct)
583df3051db2f2f70adc2498a34de1b8 (17:33): eu_neo: and you must be doing something wrong with innerHTML
583df3051db2f2f70adc2498a34de1b8 (17:33): eu_neo: you can generate code in firefox that would just detect whitespace and it would work in ie too
f96d123b2141b0d4c88bf2ec567ac153 (17:36): phade and Raevel: i've done something wrong before ... myelement.firstChild.nodeValue works in both browsers
f96d123b2141b0d4c88bf2ec567ac153 (17:36): sorry for not paying attention
583df3051db2f2f70adc2498a34de1b8 (17:49): eu_neo: but if you include whitespace also in html code then firstChild would be that whitespace in firefox
